greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of linear forests with n nodes and k rooted trees.
comment: T(n,k) is the number of trees with n nodes rooted at two noninterchangeable nodes at a distance k-1 from each other.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..200, flattened
formula: G.f. of k-th column: t(x)^k where t(x) is the g.f. of A000081.
Sum_{k=1..n} k * T(n,k) = A038002(n). - _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 04 2020
maple: T:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(k=1, b(n), (t->
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=1..n), n=1..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 04 2020
mathematica: b[n_] := b[n] = If[n < 2, n, (Sum[Sum[d*b[d], {d, Divisors[j]}]*b[n - j], {j, 1, n - 1}])/(n - 1)];
T[n_, k_] := T[n, k] = If[k == 1, b[n], With[{t = Quotient[k, 2]}, Sum[T[j, t]*T[n - j, k - t], {j, 1, n - 1}]]];
Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 1, n}], {n, 1, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 03 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: TreeGf(N) = {my(A=vector(N, j, 1)); for (n=1, N-1, A[n+1] = 1/n * sum(k=1, n, sumdiv(k, d, d*A[d]) * A[n-k+1] ) ); x*Ser(A)}
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Dec 03 2020
